Package edu.umb.cs682.ecom.backend.controllers

Class AuthController

  • Object
    • AuthController
  • @CrossOrigin(origins="*",
             maxAge=3600L)
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/auth")
public class AuthController
extends Object
    AuthController manages authentication requests from the frontend. This amounts to login, logout, and signup requests. The methods in this class directly correspond to the functions in the AuthService.js frontend class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AuthController()
      Default constructor used by Spring for field injection

      Processes signin requests.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AuthController

        public AuthController()
        Default constructor used by Spring for field injection

    • Method Detail

      • authenticateUser

        @PostMapping("/signin")
public ResponseEntity<?> authenticateUser​(@Valid @RequestBody
                                          @Valid LoginRequest loginRequest)
        Processes signin requests. Username and password are authenticated and a JWT token is generated. The JWT token is added to a whitelist granting access for 24 hours.

        The corresponding frontend requester is the login function in AuthService.js.

        Parameters:
        loginRequest - the login details, which includes a username and password
        Returns:
        the logged in user's temporary access token and profile details inside a JwtResponse

      • deactivateToken

        @PostMapping("/signout")
public ResponseEntity<?> deactivateToken​(@Valid @RequestBody
                                         @Valid JwtResponse logoutRequest)
        Processes signout requests. The provided JWT token is removed from the whitelist, rendering that token invalid.

        The corresponding frontend requester is the logout function in AuthService.js.

        Parameters:
        logoutRequest - the user details, in the same format that was returned by the authenticateUser(edu.umb.cs682.ecom.backend.payload.request.LoginRequest) method.
        Returns:
        a generic ResponseEntity with an "ok" (200) status.

      • registerUser

        @PostMapping("/signup")
public ResponseEntity<?> registerUser​(@Valid @RequestBody
                                      @Valid SignupRequest signUpRequest)
        Processes signup requests. The given user details are checked against existing user data to ensure there are no duplicate usernames or emails.

        The corresponding frontend requester is the register function in AuthService.js

        Parameters:
        signUpRequest - the user details, which include a username, email, and password
        Returns:
        a generic ResponseEntity with an "ok" (200) status and confirmation message.
